item.title: The difference between Google and Aaron Swartz | MediaFile

item.content:encoded: The difference between Google and Aaron Swartz re: MIT JSTOR hacking http://t.co/8GACNjD What’s missing from the news articles about Swartz’s arrest is a realization that the methods of collection and analysis he’s used are exactly what makes companies like Google valuable to its shareholders and its users. item.title: Backblaze Blog » Petabytes on a Budget v2.0:Revealing More Secrets
item.description: Petabytes on a Budget v2.0: Revealing More Secrets http://bit.ly/nwWPKw
item.content:encoded: Petabytes on a Budget v2.0: Revealing More Secrets http://bit.ly/nwWPKw It’s been over a year since Backblaze revealed the designs of our first generation (67 terabyte) storage pod. During that time, we’ve remained focused on our mission to provide an unlimited online backup service for $5 per month. To maintain profitability, we continue to avoid overpriced commercial solutions, and we now build the Backblaze Storage Pod 2.0: a 135-terabyte, 4U server for $7,384. It’s double the storage and twice the performance—at lower cost than the original. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: backblaze.com

item.title: Fake Apple Stores popping up in China - latimes.com
item.description: Fake Apple Stores popping up in China http://buz.tw/9SVpV
item.content:encoded: Fake Apple Stores popping up in China http://buz.tw/9SVpV Products get knocked off all the time -- designer bags, Oscar-night dresses, watches. But entire stores? That's something new. Which is why the Internet is going crazy over a blogger's report that three fake Apple stores have popped up in her neighborhood in Kunming, China. In a post dated Wednesday on the blog BirdAbroad, the citizen reporter (an employee of an international public health organization) said she was initially duped by the quality of the fake Apple store. It had the iconic clean wood interior, the Apple branded posters on the walls, the employees with those tell-tale blue polo shirts and chunky name tags hanging around their necks. The store appeared to sell real Apple products. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: latimes.com

item.description: "Jon Stewart Skewers Fox News For Belittling ‘Epic’ Murdoch Scandal" @francesmartel http://bit.ly/rlxNqz @mediaite #p2 #tcot #teaparty #fok
item.content:encoded: "Jon Stewart Skewers Fox News For Belittling ‘Epic’ Murdoch Scandal" @francesmartel http://bit.ly/rlxNqz @mediaite #p2 #tcot #teaparty #fok Given that Rupert Murdoch was to present himself before Parliament today, and given that said presentation involved a pie attack, today was ripe for the news picking for Jon Stewart, and he hit it out of the park. With a full recap that included the arrest of Mrs. Weasley that guy from Simply Red Rebekah Brooks, Wendi Deng's martial arts, and, of course, an extensive sniping of Fox News for treating NPR far harsher than sister medium News of the World. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Peeves: Anti-Americanisms | The Economist
item.description: Why do so many Brits hate Americanisms? Especially when they're not American at all? http://t.co/c5E6y5B
item.content:encoded: Why do so many Brits hate Americanisms? Especially when they're not American at all? http://t.co/c5E6y5B THE BBC, following up on an apparently successful column, asked readers to send in their least favourite Americanisms. Mark Liberman noted that of five "Americanisms" cited in the original column's first paragraph, four were of British origin. But never let facts get in the way of a good rant. Let the peeving begin! The BBC published a top fifty. The original peeve is in bold; I have removed the peevers' names and added my comments. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: economist.com

item.title: Twitter is all about real-time commerce, says CEO Dick Costolo — Tech News and Analysis
item.description: Twitter is all about real-time commerce, says CEO Dick Costolo http://dlvr.it/bwGgt
item.content:encoded: Twitter is all about real-time commerce, says CEO Dick Costolo http://dlvr.it/bwGgt Twitter wants to be "the world in your pocket," according to CEO Dick Costolo -- but more than anything, it wants to be the engine of mobile and real-time commerce in your pocket, judging by his comments at the Fortune BrainstormTech conference in Colorado on Tuesday. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: gigaom.com
